alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mt. Tabor, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danby, Clarendon, Mount Tabor, Tinmouth, Wallingford, Mt. Tabor, Pawlet, Middletown Springs, Mount Holly, Ira, Shrewsbury, Wells, East Wallingford, Clarendon Springs, Chippenhook, Cuttingsville, Danby Four Corners, South Wallingford, West Tinmouth, and East Clarendon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
